intro: Nonea suchtelenioides, commonly known as the slender Nonea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, thriving in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in compact clusters. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small organisms.
